stem: A mother brought her 16-month-old baby to the emergency room complaining of episodes of inconsolable crying for the last 24 hours. During the diaper change, she has also noticed a jelly-like stool 30 minutes ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?
disc: Intussusception is classically described as a triad of abdominal pain, palpable sausage-like mass, and passage of currant jelly. But these features are seen in only <15% of the patients. The only presenting symptom may be abdominal pain.
